intro: Isocoma azteca, commonly known as the Aztec fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually grayish-green with a fuzzy texture, and the flowers bloom in yellow and white. Isocoma azteca is often found in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
